result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy Rodgers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Timothy Rodgers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Timothy Rodgers was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Timothy Rodgers was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.3 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program and verifiable employment through pay check stubs and employer contact.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Make monthly payments towards court ordered financial obligations.
May not have contact with anyone in possession of or convicted of possession, manufacturing, delivery or growing of controlled substances.
*  Pay any co-pays or fees for any assessment, evaluation, treatment, counseling, or program referred to by DOC.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to Ct.1 but CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights and sentencing arguments are made.  
Count 1 -   Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP Concurrent with Count 3, but Consecutive to any other sentence; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision.  
Count 3 -  Defendant is sentenced to 24 months in the WSP Concurrent with Count 1, but Consecutive to any other sentence; 18 months Initial Confinement followed by 6 months Extended Supervision.  
DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Motion for 60 days sentence credit is denied by the Court.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: PT
Atty Edwards requests sentencing be adjourned as she is still waiting on a transcript from Racine Co. and wants to make sure the PSI is completely accurate; no objection by the State.  Sentencing adjourned to October 30, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Email correspondence between Hilary Edwards & Diane Christensen
Sentencing adjourned to 9/17/15 at 11:30 AM and confirmed with Atty Edwards.  Atty Edwards will provide notice to the Defendant.
Court has reviewed and approves request for adjournment on 8/14/15 with no objection by the DA's Office.
Email correspondence received from Atty Edwards requesting Sentencing on 8/14/15 be adjourned for approx. 6 week so PSI can be completed with appropriate corrections.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Attorney Hilary D. Edwards appeared on behalf of defendant who is in custody and not present in court.  Clerk: PT
Atty Edwards states she just received the PSI yesterday and requests sentencing be adjourned to allow her time to go over PSI with DE; no objection by the State.   Sentencing adj. to 8/14/15 at 9:00 AM.
